item.title: [encoding] Subjective description in `Buffer sizing` in `TextEncoder.encodeInto()`
item.content:encoded:
MDN URL

https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/TextEncoder/encodeInto

What specific section or headline is this issue about?

Buffer sizing

What information was incorrect, unhelpful, or incomplete?

The section says:

Note that the s.length * 3 is rare because the string would have to be packed with some of the few characters that expand into 3 bytes. It is unlikely that long text will exceed s.length * 2 bytes in length. Thus, a more optimistic approach might be to allocate s.length * 2 + 5 bytes, and perform reallocation in the rare circumstance that the optimistic prediction was wrong.

It may be true if the s is written in European languages, but in most case, to encode CJK strings needs s.length * 3 bytes because most of CJK characters are represented as three bytes per a character in UTF-8. So, it causes too frequent reallocation if s contains a string in CJK languages (which are used by about 20% people in the world).

What did you expect to see?

In the first place, should be such a section in a reference page? (I think it is preferred in guide pages).

If it is written in the page, it should just say that the max length needed for buffer is s.length * 3.

Do you have any supporting links, references, or citations?

No response

Do you have anything more you want to share?

No response

item.title: [encoding] Content suggestion: ImageDecoder & ImageTrackList how-to/tutorial
item.content:encoded:
What is the new suggestion?

Webcodecs introduce ImageDecoder and ImageDecoder come with ImageTrackList.
It sounds like a nice feature but I can't figure out how to provide an image file containing multiple tracks...
I even never heard about tracks inside an image and google doesn't help me at all with that.

ImageTrackList exists so I'm sure it's doable but how to package multiple tracks inside a single image file ?

Why is it important or useful?

I think it would be a great way to organised assets compared to a spritesheet but I have no idea how to create the multi-tracks-image. What tool am I suppose to use ? What would be the format of the file ?

"Does it address critical needs in the web industry?"
Probably not but this feature existed in Adobe Flash (the ability to package multiple assets, easy to target, inside a single file) and I really miss it. The idea I could do it again soon with ImageDecoder & ImageTrackList makes me very happy. Please show us a step by step example to create such images .

MDN URL: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Learn/
